fields.description:
There's 2 problems.  Empty text fields don't get persisted because the gadget plugin doesn't post the correct thing to the REST endpoint (basically missing the userpref key).

Multi selects without a selection don't get picked up by the gadget js framework, since jQuery serializeArray skips them entirely.
fields.summary: Gadget framework doesn't save empty user prefs

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA. Click on "Administration" tab.
2. Click "Add Project"
3. Upload a custom avatar for project.
4. Cancel the "Add project" operation.
5. Now click on "Add Project" link again.

Result:
1. The last uploaded custom avatar is shown as default avatar.

Expected:
1. For new project, it should always show rocket as default avatar.
fields.summary: project Avatar: Custom image uploaded for a new project(not created and cancel) is shown as default avatar when user tries to create a new project.

fields.description:
Why don't you provide a mapping of Status before the Fogbugz migration is done so that the user can choose the mapping?

Let me add that your import from Bugzilla does provide this functionality so I don't see why one import would and another one wouldn't.

I ran into an issue where we have a Step called Resolved but we call the Status Ready for Doc.

I guess you are looking for the exact wording "Resolved" in the Status as my import failed because this specific status 'Resolved' did not exist.

I think it is a worthwhile enhancement to make the import more user friendly. In CSV import and Bugzilla import, users get an option to map status this should be consistent across import options.
fields.summary: In Fogbugz import allow mapping of status before migration starts
Add ability to archive custom fields
SOAP & XML-RPC "login as" a given user

fields.description:
For a JIRA installation using MySQL (in strict mode), a URL entered into a custom field of type "URL Field" longer than 255 characters will lead to a GenericEntityException with error message _Data truncation: Data too long for column 'STRINGVALUE' at row 1_.

If this happens during a workflow transition, an integrity check is needed (assuming no transactional database backend) - quite bothersome.

I believe this is due to the fact that the length of the entry is not checked and stored with PersistenceFieldType _TYPE_LIMITED_TEXT_.

Workarounds are of course a custom validator for said type or a custom extensions of it performing the validation. However I really think this should be fixed within JIRA, perhaps by a change of the persistance type, as URLs can get long.

Another possible workaround would be to edit {{edit-basictext.vm}} to include a {{maxLength}}-attribute. The downside of this is that pasted content will be truncated silently.
fields.summary: "URL Field" entry longer than 255 characters causes GenericEntityException

fields.description:
It should be possible to operate JIRA without any delays with regards to receiving and sending Emails.

On the inbound side, it seems this would require the ability to send Email to JIRA directly from the MTA (rather than polling a POP/IMAP mailbox).
On the outbound side, it may be a simpler matter.


It's unclear to me whether this may have a significant impact on performance, but we'd be willing to take such a hit to allow "real-time" conversations via Email.
fields.summary: Allow Email to flow in real-time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17808].
  {panel}

On DB2, If you create a scheme JIRA, during startup tables with names that start with JIRA will not be found even though the tables exist:
\\
\\
{noformat}2009-06-30 13:20:10,827 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE JIRA.jiraworkflows (ID DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, workflowname VARCHAR(255), creatorname VARCHAR(255), DESCRIPTOR CLOB, ISLOCKED VARCHAR(60), CONSTRAINT PK_jiraworkflow PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.nm: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-601, SQLSTATE=42710, SQLERRMC=JIRA.JIRAWORKFLOWS;TABLE, DRIVER=3.50.152
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAACTION" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRADRAFTWORKFLOWS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAEVENTTYPE" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAISSUE" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAPERMS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,830 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAWORKFLOWS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
{noformat}

All the other tables that don't begin with JIRA will be found correctly. This does not affect the operation of JIRA - it will still work correctly.

This seems specific to DB2, postgresql doesn't exhibit the same behaviour.
fields.summary: DB2 raises errors on startup if you use a schema name that matches the start of table names e.g. JIRA

fields.description:
If one migrates JIRA from one host server to another and the OS users use inconsistent system character encoding, in some case JIRA won't be able to access the attachments.

When user tries to access an imported attachment the application server returns 404.
{quote}
    HTTP Status 404 - Could not find specified attachment: /opt/lib/jira/attachments/TST/TST-133/10259_Präsentation1.ppt (No such file or directory)

    type Status report

    message Could not find specified attachment: /opt/jira/attachments/TST/TST-133/10259_Präsentation1.ppt (No such file or directory)

    description The requested resource (Could not find specified attachment: /opt/jira/attachments/TST/TST-133/10259_Präsentation1.ppt (No such file or directory)) is not available.
    Apache Tomcat/5.5
{quote}
In the same time the imported files are visible if the content of the attachment directory (/opt/jira/attachments/TST/TST-133/) is listed.

If that is the case, you can either change back the system encoding to the original one  (locale) or alternatively migrate your attachments to the new one with help of [convmv|http://www.linux.com/feature/58689].

In order to permanently address this issue, we could replace the attachments' file names with numeric ID or store attachments in database [JRA-806|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-806].
fields.summary: Remove file names from attachments

fields.description:
Hello,

depending on the notification scheme a single user event can trigger multiple internal events that will cause a single user to receive multiple emails for each single "real world event".
It would be convenient if it was possible to coalesce all these per-event items in a single email to avoid excessive traffic in the users' mail INBOX.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: multiple Notifications should be coalesced in a single per-user email

fields.description:
Hello,

within certain organizations it would be very convenient to be able to authenticate users with x509 certificates.

Implementation would require custom OSUser providers to:
* check client certificate for:
** revocation
** validity
** identity 
* map the certificate to a JIRA username (CN to username?) and proceed with normal authorization 

I have also opened a thread on the Atlassian Forums: [Authenticating & Authorizing with x509 client certificates|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257310394&#257310394]


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: x509 client certificate Authentication and Authorization support

fields.description:
The default value for Global Permissions, Manage Group Filter Subscriptions is "jira-developers". The problem is that this means that any member of jira-developers can add "jira-users" as a group recipient of a filter subscription. If the filter results has 100 issues at approx 1KB text per issue and jira-users has 10K members, then JIRA is trying to send 1GB of email! Not surprisingly this causes JIRA to go to 100% cpu and become rather unresponsive for a *long* time. Long enough for my corporate customers' alarm systems to send them wake-up calls...

Solutions to this accidental denial of service that I can see:

1. Education - don't do that! Or warn about the expected effects.
2. Set a limit on the number of members of a group that will be emailed, and make that limit adjustable
3. Rate limit the email so that JIRA only tries to send the emails at a sustainable rate. Of course, the job may not finish before it is due again.

~Matt

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Run a query category = code. The category name in JIRA is "Code".

Result:
1. The query fails with error message "The value 'code' does not exist for the field 'category'."
2. The JQL Auto complete feature should take care of it as it do for other fields like project, assignee, reporter etc.

Expected:
1. The query should n't fail.
fields.summary: JQL: JQL auto complete doesn't take care of character case for "Category" field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17780].
  {panel}

There is a global property in JIRA called "jira.path.backup" that is used for the backup path when:

* Doing an upgrade.
* Doing an import.

This property can only be set during "Setup" and then is set for the life of the JIRA data (i.e. it is transferred with the XML).

Now we have the JIRA home, do we actually need this property. For instance we could:

# Try to dump any XML into the directory configured for a backup service.
# If this does not work, dump into "JIRA.HOME/export" 

At the very least, we should allow this property to be set after the initial install. Maybe we should be able to specify the direct during the import or before the upgrade?
fields.summary: There are two backup paths in JIRA.

Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Try to run a query like summary ~ and or try to use any of the reserved words from the list.

Result:
1. User get message "Unable to parse the query 'summary ~ and' with thrown exception: 'An error occured while parsing the JQL 'summary ~ and'.'."
2. The message help user least and will take some time to figure out what exactly is issue.

Expected:
1. A proper error message explaining that reserved words should be used within quotes or explaining that you can't use reserved words without quotes.

fields.description:
We have some bugs with unusual characters in, for whatever reason (presumably data that got pasted in from somewhere).  I've found some with a 0xc character for example, and Jira doesn't seem to prevent these going into a bug description.

When you then access such a bug via the SOAP API, there's an exception on the server (there's a callstack in the log) and the SOAP client gets a truncated XML file (which isn't valid XML).
fields.summary: SOAP API fails when bug description contains characters that are invalid in XML (such as 0xc)

fields.description:
Say I have a select-list custom field with options "foo", "bar" and "baz", and then add a 2d stats portlet with this custom field as one of the axes:

!2dstats_cf.png!

I then delete the "foo" option from the possible select list values.  The deleted value disappears from issues and from the search results (ie. main lucene index), but whatever part of Lucene the 2d stats portlet uses is not updated, and the stats portlet doesn't update (even after a JIRA restart).

Clicking on one of the now invalid links to the issue counts show this error:

Invalid value 'Foo' passed for customfield 'SelectList'. Allowed values are: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.option.OptionsImpl@1bd856a[optionsLookup={10001=Bar, 10002=Baz},relatedField=com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.FieldConfigImpl@afafbfa6,reorderer=com.atlassian.jira.util.CollectionReorderer@13d26fd,optionsManager=com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.manager.CachedOptionsManager@1cad7c3,size=2]

Reindexing JIRA fixes the problem.
fields.summary: 2d stats portlet does not update when select list custom field option is deleted
Properly support HTML in select-list options

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17720].
  {panel}

Hello all,

another method to capture thread dumps should be added to the documentation page: [Thread Dump|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/threaddump.html].

Since JDK1.5 the following general procedure is possible:
* identify the PID of the JIRA process
** on Microsoft Windows configure the Task Manager to display process PIDs (View > Select Columns... > PID) and search for Image Name "tomcat5.exe"
** on UNIX like systems use command "{{ps}}"
* on a command line shell and execute the following:
** "JDK_PATH/bin/jstack.exe -l PID >> WRITABLE_PATH/threaddump.log" (works on both Microsoft Windows and UNIX)
* attach the generated file

Best,
Eddy

fields.description:
We use JIRA enterprise and need to use a different set of "Resolutions" for each issue type (to avoid showing the use a long list of resolutions where some are not applicable for the current issue type).  

The only way to avoid this seems to be to create a separate workflow for each issue type and then use the "jira.field.resolution.exclude" propery for the "Resolve Issue" transistion to limit which resolutions are presented to the user.  

This solution (the only solutionI know of) requires that a separate workflow be created for each issue type.  We really want to use the same workflow for each issue type.  But we do want to specify a custom set of resolutions for each issue type.  When we do need to change the workflow (i.e., add or modify steps or transistion), we are forced to make the same changes to each workflow for each issue type.

This could be avoided if Atlassian introduced the concept of an "Issue Type Resolution Scheme".  This would be a scheme where each issue type could be mapped to a set of resolutions.  With this feature, we could use a single workflow for each issue type *and* we could have a custom set of resolutions for each issue type.
fields.summary: Need a "Issue Type Resolution Scheme".

fields.description:
It is possible to pass both JQL and old URL parameters into the advanced navigator view. At the moment the URL parameters are ignored. We need to make the advanced navigator accept the old parameters correctly. The current things that are currently broken (at least):

# The URL parameters seem to be ignored by the advanced view even when valid. Internally the Query with the URL parameters and JQL is created, however, it is lost somewhere.
# The URL parameters will only be read in when the parameter reset=update is added to the URL.
# The {{SearchInputTransformers.getSearchClause}} will return null for invalid URL parameters. This means that invalid URL parameters are silently dropped from the generated query. We need them to return the invalid clause so the regular JQL error handling will work.
fields.summary: Advanced Navigator view drops invalid URL parameters.

fields.description:
The Issue Navigator used to have code that obtained the SearchContext for new searches using the "pid" and "type" URL parameters. With the introduction of the JQL, the SearchConext needs to come from "pid", "type" and the JQL. 

The main problem here is that to generate the SearchContext we need the complete Query, but to correctly generate the Query we need the SearchContext. This is why the old JIRA code used to get a stupid SearchContext off the URL parameters.

We can solve this in at lest the following ways:

# Use the jqlQuery, pid and type parameters to generate a stupid SearchContext before we construct the query. If we hit a Query that is too complex, then we can just jump straight over to "Advanced Navigator". 
# Create a Clause without validation initially, then validate after you get the whole query. This will probably require changes to Issue Navigator but may be cleaner but will also require us to ensure that the {{SearchInputTransformer.getSearchClause}} and {{SearchInputTransformer.populateFromQuery}} round trip correctly with invalid parameters and input. In particular, I know that the {{getSearchClause}} method do not currently work with invalid parameters, they just drop them.

In any case, we need to think about how doesItFit ^TM^ works with this again. If validation fails, should we do a doesItFit calculation and move off onto advanced or should we stay in the simple navigator and display the validation errors. I guess this really depends on whether or no the doesItFit works with invalid queries (I'm pretty sure that it does not).
fields.summary: Navigator Context Calcuation does not work correctly when dealing with JQL parameters and 3.13.x parameters.

fields.description:
If you run a search request view (e.g. XML view) with the clause {{created < QWERTY}}, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown back to the user.

This is because the DateRelationalQueryFactory assumes that the list of values that come back from the operands contains 1 element. So to fix this, check that the list returned is not null, and has exactly one element - otherwise the false result should be returned.

When fixing this factory, please check other factories for similar bugs (a few of the factories use a similar pattern). This should be func-tested when doing the search request URLs - so be sure to remember invalid inputs for *every single clause* as test cases.

(Note: Estimate does not include the func test just described.)
fields.summary: Relational Date Clause Query Factory throws IndexOutOfBoundsException on bad operand when creating query not through IssueNavigator

fields.description: The text fields do not handle multiple "QueryLiteral" values being returned. It is possible for an Operand to return multiple values and not be a list. We should handle this like any other field. For example, summary ~ echo(a, c) should be translated into summary ~ a or summary ~ c like anything else. At the moment we simply ignore anything but the QueryLiteral and log a useless message.
fields.summary: Text JQL fields do not handle multiple QueryLiteral objects.

fields.description:
The query "summary ~ echo("*JIRA", "CONFLUENCE")" does not return an error message during validation, while the query "summary ~ echo("*JIRA")" does. 

The echo function simply echos its arguments back as query literals. It does not return a list but may return multiple query literal objects (which is allowed and expected under JQL).
fields.summary: Validating "summary ~ echo("*JIRA", "CONFLUENCE")" does not work.

fields.description:
For better supportability, we should prompt users in the XML Import page a checkbox option to clear out values from the backup such as:
* Outbound/Inbound Mail Servers

It seems too common where users restore a backup, and find their test/dev JIRA instances picking up mail messages from their production mailbox.  It can be quite a headache to reconcile all the issues if this goes unnoticed for a while.
fields.summary: Allow option to clear certain properties during XML import

fields.description:

fields.summary: Concurrency bug in Constants Manager

fields.description:
The SearchRequestFactory (rewritten in 4.0) is used in 3 places: IssueNavigator, Jelly and SearchRequestURLHandler.

IssueNavigator handles its own validation of parameters, so it is free to call the create method on the factory knowing that it will not perform any validation. The URLHandler however does not perform any validation on parameters (it does validate JQL). But, instead of throwing an exception when trying to create a SearchRequest with invalid parameters, it silently drops them (in some cases - I have not checked all searchers).

For example, access an XML view with a temporary search request, e.g. {{/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?created%3Abefore=QWERTY}}. The {{created:before}} parameter contains an invalid value, but the DateSearchInputTransformer#getSearchClause() method treats this the same as if the parameter was not specified. Thus, the XML view will actually return all issues (since no other parameters or JQL were specified).

This is not ideal - we should be returning a 400 code response to the client telling them that their input was invalid. The suggested way to do this (there might be others) is to create another method on the SearchRequestFactory interface that returns a Result object, which can contain the error messages produced when trying to create the search request from the invalid parameters. This would then be called instead of the old create method, and the URLHandler could properly report back the errors to the client.
fields.summary: Create search request factory method that also validates inputs / dont silently drop invalid params in SearchRequestURLHandler

fields.description:
JIRA 4.0 is now Java5 minimum. A lot of classes use the backport of the java.util.concurrent stuff and should be converted to use the VM supplied library versions.

This should give a small improvement in performance.
fields.summary: Remove dependency on backport.util.concurrent
Errors from Crowd are not captured properly during Forgot Password action if password complexity rules are set

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as admin.
2. Click on "Project Role Browser" link.
3. Click "Manage Default member" for any of the project role.
4. Click "edit" to add groups.
5. Open the group picker and select any of the group. Click "Select"

Result:
1. Nothing happens.
2. Writing the actual group name in "Add Group" dialog adds the group. No auto complete is available.
3. The issue is not there with released 3.13.4.

Expected:
1. The user should be able to add groups using group picker.
fields.summary: Adding group for "Project Role Browser" using group picker is not working.

fields.description:
Can you please add the a warning box to the following three pages stating that the "Fix Versions" field *MUST NOT* be hidden in order for Changelog and Roadmap to work.

Here is the article describing the problem:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/%27Road+Map%27%2C+%27Change+Log%27+and+%27Versions%27+project+tabs+are+not+visible

Here are the pages to change:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/changelog_report.html

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/reports_summary.html

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/roadmap_report.html

Can you add the warning at the top of the pages so that its the first thing users see?

Thanks,
Jon
fields.summary: Add a warning to the reports documentation.

fields.description:
I am actually not sure if this is working as intended or a bug but I thought I'd file it just in case.  

If you create an issue in one time zone, and then change the time zone of your Jira instance to an earlier time zone and create a new issue, you will find that your second created issue has an earlier create data than the first one.  So, the first issue's create date is not representing itselft itself in the new time zone.
fields.summary: If you change your Jira's time zone it doesn't update the Create data of previously created issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17679].
  {panel}

Hello all,

under certain conditions, the following caption for the Issue Type field in the Issue Edit screen can be confusing and misleading:
{quote}
There are no issue types with compatible field configuration and/or workflow associations. 
The issue type can only be changed by moving this issue.
{quote}
One such case is:
* in the Issue Type Scheme there is really no other compatible issue type at all (eg: a scheme containing only a regular issue and a sub-task)
* a link to _move_ the issue is still displayed and will cause users to follow the link
* they will only receive the option to move the issue to the same issue type (the sub-task is filtered out)
* finally get an error message when attempting to follow through as it is not possible to move an issue to the same issue type

The application should not display this message when there is no real option to move an issue (or at least display a more explanatory message).


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Edit Issue Type field caption confusing when there is no compatible issue type

fields.description:
I was hunting around today trying to figure out how to delete a screenshot.  I did not realise that the link for Manage Attachments under section File Attachments also applies to Image Attachments.

Can you please duplicate the link in the section below?  It will be more clear for other users.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Issue summary page: Please duplicate link "Manage Attachments" under section "Image Attachments"

fields.description:
If you goto the page to add an "Update Field" post function, then click away, you will get an isDirty warning, even if the form has not been modified.  This is more to do with the javascript for the post function, than with the isDirty logic.

Needs to be rewritten and JQuery'ed.
